page.title: 02PATRON SAINT OF LOSSIEMOUTH.
page.content: St.Gerardine arrived in this area in 934 A.D.His real name is said to be Garnat but his Latin name is St.Gervadius.Some people say that he is Irish whilst others say that he is from the N.E.His cave was hewn from the rock face and it is here that the War Memorial can now be seen.In the 18th century,when stones were quarried from there for building,his cave disappeared.St.Gerardine patrolled the shore where the harbour is now, with a lantern,which shone on the breakers to warn sailors of the danger.When Lossiemouth became a burgh,the Town Council chose St.Gerardine and his lamp to grace the Burgh Seal.
